description:
MailKit is an Open Source cross-platform .NET mail-client library that is based on MimeKit and optimized for mobile devices.

Features include:
* SASL Authentication via NTLM, DIGEST-MD5, CRAM-MD5, LOGIN, PLAIN, and XOAUTH2.
* A fully-cancellable SmtpClient with support for STARTTLS, 8BITMIME, BINARYMIME and PIPELINING
* A fully-cancellable Pop3Client with support for STLS, UIDL, and APOP.
* A fully-cancellable ImapClient with support for LITERAL+, NAMESPACE, CHILDREN, LOGINDISABLED, STARTTLS, MULTIAPPEND, UNSELECT, UIDPLUS, CONDSTORE, ESEARCH, SASL-IR, COMPRESS, ENABLE, QRESYNC, SORT, THREAD, ESORT, SPECIAL-USE, MOVE, XLIST, and X-GM-EXT1.
* Client-side sorting and threading of messages (the Ordinal Subject and the Jamie Zawinski threading algorithms are supported).
* S/MIME and PGP support via MimeKit
* Microsoft TNEF support via MimeKit
releaseNotes:
* Implemented a workaround for a GMail IMAP bug in the BODYSTRUCTURE response for messages with message/rfc822 attachments.
* Fixed a logic bug in MemMove which sometimes caused corruption of messages while downloading via IMAP or POP3.
* Implemented async versions of all SmtpClient, Pop3Client, ImapClient, and ImapFolder methods.
* Renamed IMessageService to IMailService, IMessageSpool to IMailSpool, IMesageStore to IMailStore, and IMessageTransport to IMailTransport.
* Renamed IFolder to IMailFolder for consistency.
* Improved documentation.
summary: An Open Source .NET mail-client library for Windows, Mac, Linux, and mobile platforms such as iOS and Android.
title: MailKit
